Amazing progression! I have been a fan of Abel since Thur, HoB, EoS...I 
know a lot of people are expressing concerns that The Weeknd has sold out. 
Truthfully? The dude has souled out... Abel's hypnotic, languid, pill 
induced, alcohol hazed, Tripthym and Blues style has expanded into an area 
where he can grow. The riffs, bars, production, and content are still the 
Weeknd, but with some more polish and sophistication. Where I used to 
envision Abel jamming his tunes in a dark basement, under a blue (or red) 
light, in a smoke filled room, with a speak easy like undertone of 
questionable legality...well I can still see that. I can also feel a new 
appreciation for musical craftsmanship, almost like this album has more to 
say. It's more than drugs, women, and pain...I mean it still seems to be 
about that lyrically, but there is more this time; it just feels musically 
deeper rather than darker. I just love where this dude is going. Keep it up 
AT, you are making amazing music that matters to a lot of people. Stay true 
and do your thing man.
